# Task

You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

```julia
using DataFrames

df_cars = DataFrame(manufacturer=["audi", "ford", "bmw"], model=["a4", "fusion", "m3"])

function audi_filter(df)
    # Filter the dataset to only rows with manufacturer "audi" and model "a4 or "a4 quattro"
    df = filter(row -> row.manufacturer == "audi" && (row.model == "a4" || row.model == "a4 quattro"), df)
    
    # Add a new column "audi_a4_type" that equals true across all rows
    df["audi_a4_type"] = fill(true, size(df, 1))
    
    return df
end
```

Calling the function on `df_cars` will output:
```julia
julia> audi_filter(df_cars)
5×3 DataFrame
│ Row │ manufacturer ┆ model     ┆ audi_a4_type │
├─────┼───────────────┼────────────┼──────────────┤
│ 1  ┆ "audi"       ┆ "a4"      ┆ true          │
│ 2  ┆ "audi"       ┆ "a4 quattro" ┆ true          │
```
